N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 25.1 - Annual beer function permit

State Regulations
A brewer or a beer wholesaler to whom an annual beer
function permit has been issued under subdivision 2 of section 97 [Alcoholic

Beverage Control Law] shall exercise the privileges conferred by such permit
only under the following conditions: (a) The permittee should require every person
to whom beer shall be sold for use at such function to file with such permittee
a statement as follows: Invoice No. ____________
I, __________
(Name) residing at
(Residence)
________ state that I am the (person) (authorized
representative of the organization) who is purchasing
(Amount) cases barrels of beer from
(Name of Permittee) (Permit No.) for consumption at a
function to be held on
____________
(Month)
(Day)
(Year)
by
__________
(Name and Address of Organization) at
____________
(Location where function is to be held)
and further that the beer is to be purchased for
consumption only, at said function, and not for resale; that the general public
will not be admitted to said function; and that admission thereto is not
contingent upon the payment of an admission fee, contribution or donation of
any kind. I understand that this statement will be accepted for all
purposes as the equivalent of an affidavit and if false will subject me to the
same penalties as if I had been duly sworn. ______________
(Signature and Office in Organization)

Dated
(Residence Address)
(b) Such statements shall have noted thereon
the invoice number pertaining to the sale and shall be maintained in a separate
file in chronological sequence. (c) Such statements and invoices of sale shall be maintained for a period of at
least two years, and shall be available for inspection by any authorized
representative of the Liquor Authority. Notes
